extendedIngredients.name: carrots
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 small carrots, cut into thin matchsticks

extendedIngredients.name: mint
extendedIngredients.originalString: small handful each coriander and mint, chopped

extendedIngredients.name: prawns
extendedIngredients.originalString: 140g cooked prawns in chilli, lime and coriander (we used Waitrose)

recipes.title: Crunchy prawn & noodle salad

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Tiamo Pinot Grigio with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 8 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Tiamo Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Light straw yellow color. Fresh and rich fruity aromas of apple and pear with a hint of citrus fruit that fade into the floral bouquet. Fresh and fruity, very clean and crisp.Tiamo Pinot Grigio pairs well with a wide array of lighter cuisine, especially fish/shellfish, poultry, pastas in cream sauce and softer cheeses. It's also an ideal aperitif.

recipes.instructions: Soak the noodles in boiling waterfollowing the pack instructions. Drainand run under cold water until cool, thendrain well again. Mix the noodles withthe carrots, spring onions, coriander,mint and prawns.In a small bowl, whisk the remainingingredients together, pour over thenoodle salad and toss well to coat.Store in containers until ready to eat.

steps.step: Soak the noodles in boiling waterfollowing the pack instructions.
Drainand run under cold water until cool, thendrain well again.

Mix the noodles withthe carrots, spring onions, coriander,mint and prawns.In a small bowl, whisk the remainingingredients together, pour over thenoodle salad and toss well to coat.Store in containers until ready to eat.
